## Introduction

Students now spend several hours a day on social media, making it an ordinary element of their lives. Although it provides social interaction and amusement, frequent use may impair students' self-control. Distractions, impulsive conduct and time management issues are all associated with excessive screen Using the data collected in 2024 from a student survey, we gain a deeper understanding of how students digital habits influence their conduct and determining whether media use is associated with a loss of self-control.
